Export.zv: Cache for UNIX (Red Hat Enterprise Linux for x86-64) 2015.2.2 (Build 805U)

Method.name: run
Method.Description:
This version is used in display formatting. The legacy "UDate" converter is still used in dictionary items and is destined for deprecation. Convert a Unix Epoch date to a visual

Options can be in any order and consist of the following flags:

  • D - Return only the date part
  • T - Return only the time part
  • I - Return the requested value part in internal format (NOTE: Dates are in the MV epoch, not Cache. Time is reckoned identially in both.)

    • if no options are specified, then an external date-and-time string is returned.

    if "I" is specified, then either "D" or "T" must be specified.

Method.Implementation:
if $get(parameters)="" then return "Must pass parameters to " : @ME->%ClassName(1) arg = parameters->get("value")
UnixDate = field(arg, ":", 1) OptionFlags = field(arg, ":", 2)
if Abs( UnixDate ) = 0 then return oConv( @date, "D4/" ) end
Time = rem( UnixDate, 86400 ) Days = int( ( UnixDate - Time ) / 86400 ) + 732
begin case
case OptionFlags = @ME->nil Results = OCONV( Days, "D4/" ) : " " : OCONV( Time, "MTS" )
case ( index( OptionFlags, "D", 1 ) > 0 )
if index( OptionFlags, "I", 1 ) > 0 then Results = Days end else Results = OCONV( Days, "D4/" ) end
case ( index( OptionFlags, "T", 1 ) > 0 )
if index( OptionFlags, "I", 1 ) > 0 then Results = Time end else Results = OCONV( Time, "MTS" ) end
end case
return Results
